By adopting these measures, China would become a global leader on fentanyl control and avoid being seen as the source of the world‚Äôs most pressing drug problem. #OpioidCrisisResponse https://www.alexander.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?p=PressReleases&id=FCC9B82B-AB7A-45EC-9FBE-AC7B4D3054EF
Scheduling fentanyl as a class and enhancing enforcement against illicit fentanyl producers are the keys to stemming the flow of fentanyl substances from China to the U.S and other countries.
So the request we made of Chinese officials was this: control all fentanyl substances as a class, just as the Trump Administration did for the U.S. in November, 2017.
China cooperates with U.S. law enforcement agencies to combat the fentanyl crisis, but our cooperation faces challenges when a substance is not on China‚Äôs controlled substances list.
China has already made 25 fentanyl compounds illegal, and, according to the @DEAHQ, we saw an immediate and dramatic decrease in those chemicals coming to the U.S. #OpioidCrisisResponse
